text: Since June 2022, floods in Pakistan have killed at least 1,191 people, including 399 children. The floods were caused by monsoon rains and melting glaciers. It is the world's deadliest flood since the 2017 South Asian floods. On August 25, Pakistan declared a state of emergency because of the flooding. By August 29, it was said that around 'one-third' of the country was underwater. By September 2, the death toll passed 1,200. ==References== Category:June 2022 events Category:July 2022 events Category:August 2022 events Category:September 2022 events Category:2022 in Pakistan Category:2022 floods Category:2022 disasters in Asia Category:2020s disasters in Pakistan
title: 2022 Pakistan floods
